```{r num2}
rows <- 5
cols <- 5

for (i in 1:rows) {
  for (j in 1:cols) {
    if (j <= i) {
      cat("* ")
    } else {
      cat("  ")
    }
  }
  cat("\n")
}

```

```{r num3 }
n <- as.integer(readline(prompt = "Enter a number to start the Fibonacci sequence: "))

a <- 0
b <- 1

cat(a, " ")

repeat {

  next_term <- a + b
  

  if (next_term > 500) {
    break
  }
  
  cat(next_term, " ")
  
  a <- b
  b <- next_term
}

cat("\n")

```

```{r num 4b}
male_subset <- subset(Household_data, Gender...6 == "M")
female_subset <- subset(Household_data, Gender...6 == "F")

num_male <- nrow(male_subset)
num_female <- nrow(female_subset)

cat("Number of observations in Male subset:", num_male, "\n")
cat("Number of observations in Female subset:", num_female, "\n")
```

```{r num 4c}
missing_values <- sum(is.na(Household_data$Gender...6) | Household_data$Gender...6 == "")

if (missing_values > 0) {
  count_gender <- table(Household_data$Gender...6)


  barplot(count_gender, main = "Number of Males and Females",
          xlab = "Gender", ylab = "Count",
          col = c("blue", "pink"), legend = TRUE)
}
```
